verses.roman:
tabe gāli, śāpa dite bhaṭṭācārya āilā
nindā śuni' mahāprabhu hāsite lāgilā

synonyms: tabe—at that time; gāli—calling by ill names; śāpa dite—cursing; bhaṭṭācārya—Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya; āilā—came back; nindā śuni'-hearing the criticism; mahāprabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; hāsite lāgilā—began to laugh.
translation: Bhaṭṭācārya then began to curse and call his son-in-law ill names. When Bhaṭṭācārya returned, he saw that Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu was laughing to hear him criticize Amogha.
